meanings.definition: Be situated on each side of or on one side of (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: The trees flanked the path, creating a shady tunnel.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers flanked the general as he marched through the town.
meanings.sent3: The friendly dog flanked the little girl, wagging its tail happily.
meanings.sent4: The mountains flanked the valley like silent guardians.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flowers flanked the entrance, welcoming visitors with their beauty.

meanings.definition: Provide (someone) with a flank or flanks
meanings.sent1: The chef flanked the steak with roasted vegetables for a delicious presentation.
meanings.sent2: The bodyguards flanked the celebrity as she walked down the red carpet.
meanings.sent3: The helpful assistant flanked the manager, ready to assist with any task.
meanings.sent4: The wings flanked the main dish, adding a burst of flavor to the meal.
meanings.sent5: The loyal knights flanked the king, ready to defend him at any moment.
